text:
Prince Harry loves Rugby match but it might pretty difficult for him without attending without Meghan Markle. While spending his weekend in London, the royal family member went to The Stoop for an afternoon of matches.

The Patron of England Rugby watched England's Red Roses vs. Wales in the Women's Six Nations AKA Rugby's Greatest Championship.

Photographers caught Harry in the stands as he wore a black trench coat and light blue tie while clapping and cheering throughout the game.

After Red Roses' victory by 52-0, the bride-to-be met the players and coaches from both teams.

Now to Twickenham for @EnglandRugby v @WelshRugbyUnion #sixnations First Prince Harry is meeting beneficiaries of @TheRugbyCharity, which supports players who sustain a catastrophic spinal cord injury or traumatic brain injury playing the game pic.twitter.com/IXa0HPNIFm — Kensington Palace (@KensingtonRoyal) February 10, 2018

Harry was also expected to attend the NatWest 6 Nations England vs. Wales match at Twickenham Stadium.

While the former Suits star wasn't in attendance for the rugby matches, the couple's fans should not be bothered in the slightest.

As previously reported, following Prince William and Kate Middleton's hit movie in 2011, William and Kate: The Movie, Lifetime is on the way to make a new film Harry and Meghan: A Royal Romance on Meghan and Harry.

After Meghan and Harry, who announced their engagement last November, the couple will hold their wedding on 19 May 2018 at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle.
title: Prince Harry Can Not Get Enough of Rugby While Attending Matches Without Meghan Markle
